result.markdown: --- title: "Tabels in R - Data frames and tibbles" --- ```{=html} ``` [Slides in full screen](slides/data-tibbles.html){target="_blank"}     Download PDF slides :::{.panel-tabset} # Task ## 1 Getting started with tibbles Before you start the task: - Install the tibble package by calling `install.packages("tibble")` in the console. - Open your script for the task and put `library(tibble)` on top - Execute this line and the tibble package is loaded into your R session and ready to use ## 2 Creating a tibble Use the vectors `species`, `brainwt_kg`, `bodywt_kg` from before and combine them in a tibble. ## 3 Exploring the tibble Explore the tibble you created with the different functions that you learned in the presentation. You can for example try - `view()` and explore what you can do in the view window that opens: searching, filtering, sorting columns - `str()` to view the structure of the data - `summary()` - ... ## 4 Indexing and selecting Now let's try some indexing on the data. Select - Rows 1, 5, and 7 and the columns `species` and `bodywt_kg` - select rows 1 to 10, all columns - select the column `bodywt_kg` as a vector --- ## Extra - Select the last column of the last row without using the row and column index (so don't use any numbers in this command) - Calculate the mean of the `bodywt_kg` column and save it in a variable - Add a new column to the data called `ratio_body_brain` with the ratio of the columns `bodywt_kg` and `brainwt_kg` # Solution ### 3.2 Creating a tibble Use the vectors `species`, `brainwt_kg`, `bodywt_kg` from the last task and put them in a tibble. ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_643ce999542337d8d383e39e65534753'} ```{.r .cell-code} # install.packages("tibble") library(tibble) species <- c( "MountainBeaver", "Cow", "GreyWolf", "Goat", "GuineaPig", "Diplodocus", "AsianElephant", "Donkey", "Horse", "PotarMonkey", "Cat", "Giraffe", "Gorilla", "Human", "AfricanElephant", "Triceratops", "RhesusMonkey", "Kangaroo", "GoldenHamster", "Mouse", "Rabbit", "Sheep", "Jaguar", "Chimpanzee", "Rat", "Brachiosaurus", "Mole", "Pig" ) bodywt_kg <- c( 1.4, 465, 36.3, 27.7, 1., 11700, 2547, 187.1, 521, 10, 3.3, 529, 207, 62, 6654, 9400, 6.8, 35, 0.1, 0.02, 2.5, 55.5, 100, 52.2, 0.3, 87000, 0.1, 192 ) brainwt_kg <- c( 0.0081, 0.423, 0.1195, 0.115, 0.0055, 0.05, 4.603, 0.419, 0.655, 0.115, 0.0256, 0.68, 0.406, 1.32, 5.712, 0.07, 0.179, 0.056, 0.001, 0.0004, 0.0121, 0.175, 0.157, 0.44, 0.0019, 0.1545, 0.003, 0.18 ) # Creating the tibble animals <- tibble( species = species, bodywt_kg = bodywt_kg, brainwt_kg = brainwt_kg ) ``` ::: ### 3.3 Exploring the tibble In the view window that opens, you have some options to filter the data and sort rows. ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_855aec1df0330f32d41f5a45a9e3edcd'} ```{.r .cell-code} view(animals) ``` ::: ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_6d73ded18d8c2db9f4892c2de0be837f'} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(animals) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` species bodywt_kg brainwt_kg Length:28 Min. : 0.02 Min. :0.00040 Class :character 1st Qu.: 3.10 1st Qu.:0.02223 Mode :character Median : 53.85 Median :0.13700 Mean : 4278.44 Mean :0.57452 3rd Qu.: 479.00 3rd Qu.:0.42000 Max. :87000.00 Max. :5.71200 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} str(animals) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` tibble [28 × 3] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) $ species : chr [1:28] "MountainBeaver" "Cow" "GreyWolf" "Goat" ... $ bodywt_kg : num [1:28] 1.4 465 36.3 27.7 1 ... $ brainwt_kg: num [1:28] 0.0081 0.423 0.1195 0.115 0.0055 ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} nrow(animals) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 28 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ncol(animals) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} names(animals) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "species" "bodywt_kg" "brainwt_kg" ``` ::: ::: ### 3.4 Indexing and selecting - Rows 1, 5, and 7 and the columns `species` and `bodywt_kg` ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_e31ebfc50a85b024e3eeab792883a23f'} ```{.r .cell-code} animals[c(1,5,7), c("species", "bodywt_kg")] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 species bodywt_kg 1 MountainBeaver 1.4 2 GuineaPig 1 3 AsianElephant 2547 ``` ::: ::: - Select rows 1 to 10, all columns ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_7d86303adff57a53cafbf93e6a95e8d2'} ```{.r .cell-code} animals[1:10, ] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 × 3 species bodywt_kg brainwt_kg 1 MountainBeaver 1.4 0.0081 2 Cow 465 0.423 3 GreyWolf 36.3 0.120 4 Goat 27.7 0.115 5 GuineaPig 1 0.0055 6 Diplodocus 11700 0.05 7 AsianElephant 2547 4.60 8 Donkey 187. 0.419 9 Horse 521 0.655 10 PotarMonkey 10 0.115 ``` ::: ::: - Select the column `bodywt_kg` as a vector using `$` ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_c7117161d01a6f258f9c7b946350ad2c'} ```{.r .cell-code} animals$bodywt_kg ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1.40 465.00 36.30 27.70 1.00 11700.00 2547.00 187.10 [9] 521.00 10.00 3.30 529.00 207.00 62.00 6654.00 9400.00 [17] 6.80 35.00 0.10 0.02 2.50 55.50 100.00 52.20 [25] 0.30 87000.00 0.10 192.00 ``` ::: ::: #### Extra - Select the last column of the last row without using the row and column index (so don't use any numbers in this command) ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_ab9e39d874f4b7f5892c2530b8c713f1'} ```{.r .cell-code} animals[nrow(animals), ncol(animals)] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 1 brainwt_kg 1 0.18 ``` ::: ::: - Calculate the mean of the `bodywt_kg` column and save it in a variable ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_66876ef6e1708800a44304db39d38f76'} ```{.r .cell-code} mean_wt <- mean(animals$bodywt_kg) mean_wt ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 4278.44 ``` ::: ::: - Add a new column to the data called `ratio_body_brain` with the ratio of the columns `bodywt_kg` and `brainwt_kg` ::: {.cell hash='04_data-tibbles_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_e60a1b5323483e34c7db2ff85239a77e'} ```{.r .cell-code} animals$ratio_body_brain <- animals$bodywt_kg / animals$brainwt_kg animals ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 28 × 4 species bodywt_kg brainwt_kg ratio_body_brain 1 MountainBeaver 1.4 0.0081 173. 2 Cow 465 0.423 1099. 3 GreyWolf 36.3 0.120 304. 4 Goat 27.7 0.115 241. 5 GuineaPig 1 0.0055 182. 6 Diplodocus 11700 0.05 234000 7 AsianElephant 2547 4.60 553. 8 Donkey 187. 0.419 447. 9 Horse 521 0.655 795. 10 PotarMonkey 10 0.115 87.0 # ℹ 18 more rows ``` ::: ::: :::
